001package io.jstach.ezkv.kvs;
002
003import java.io.FileNotFoundException;
004import java.io.IOException;
005import java.io.UncheckedIOException;
006import java.net.URI;
007import java.nio.file.NoSuchFileException;
008import java.util.ArrayList;
009import java.util.List;
010import java.util.Objects;
011import java.util.function.Consumer;
012import java.util.function.Function;
013
014/**
015 * Represents a loader responsible for loading {@link KeyValues} from configured sources.
016 * This interface defines the contract for loading key-value pairs, potentially involving
017 * interpolation or resource chaining.
018 *
019 * <p>
020 * Implementations of this interface may load key-values from various sources such as
021 * files, classpath resources, or system properties.
022 *
023 * @see KeyValues
024 * @see Variables
025 */
026public interface KeyValuesLoader {
027
028        /**
029         * Loads key-values from configured sources.
030         * @return a {@link KeyValues} instance containing the loaded key-value pairs
031         * @throws IOException if an I/O error occurs during loading
032         * @throws FileNotFoundException if a specified resource is not found (old io)
033         * @throws NoSuchFileException if a specified resource is not found (nio)
034         * @throws KeyValuesException if an error occurs while processing keys such as
035         * interpolation or invalid resource keys.
036         * @throws UncheckedIOException if an IO error happens that had to be wrapped. Some
037         * loaders may throw an unchecked IO because of the difficulty of checked exceptions.
038         * The KeyValues system will unwrap the exception and check if it is one of the
039         * previous missing resource exceptions.
040         */
041        public KeyValues load()
042                        throws IOException, FileNotFoundException, NoSuchFileException, KeyValuesException, UncheckedIOException;
043
044        /**
045         * A builder class for constructing instances of {@link KeyValuesLoader}. The builder
046         * allows adding multiple sources from which key-values will be loaded, as well as
047         * setting variables for interpolation. <strong>Note that the order of the "add" and
048         * {@link #variables} methods does matter.</strong>
049         *
050         * @apiNote The creation of the builder is currently encapsulated at the moment and is
051         * done by {@link KeyValuesSystem#loader}.
052         * @see KeyValuesSystem#loader()
053         */
054        public final class Builder implements KeyValuesLoader {
055
056                final Function<Builder, KeyValuesLoader> loaderFactory;
057
058                final List<Function<KeyValuesEnvironment, ? extends NamedKeyValuesSource>> sources = new ArrayList<>();
059
060                final List<Function<KeyValuesEnvironment, ? extends Variables>> variables = new ArrayList<>();
061
062                private int resourceCount = 0;
063
064                private String namePrefix = "root";
065
066                Builder(Function<Builder, KeyValuesLoader> loaderFactory) {
067                        super();
068                        this.loaderFactory = loaderFactory;
069                }
070
071                /**
072                 * Adds a {@link KeyValuesResource} as a source to the loader.
073                 * @param resource the resource to add
074                 * @return this builder instance
075                 */
076                public Builder add(KeyValuesResource resource) {
077                        sources.add(e -> resource);
078                        resourceCount++;
079                        return this;
080                }
081
082                /**
083                 * Add resource using callback on builder.
084                 * @param uri uri of resource
085                 * @param builder builder to add additional properties.
086                 * @return this.
087                 */
088                public Builder add(String uri, Consumer<KeyValuesResource.Builder> builder) {
089                        var b = KeyValuesResource.builder(uri);
090                        builder.accept(b);
091                        return add(b.build());
092                }
093
094                /**
095                 * Adds a named {@link KeyValues} source to the loader.
096                 * @param name the name of the source
097                 * @param keyValues the key-values to add
098                 * @return this builder instance
099                 */
100                public Builder add(String name, KeyValues keyValues) {
101                        sources.add(e -> new NamedKeyValues(name, keyValues));
102                        return this;
103                }
104
105                /**
106                 * Adds a {@link URI} as a source by wrapping it in a {@link KeyValuesResource}.
107                 * The name of the resource will be automatically generated based on
108                 * {@link #namePrefix(String)} and a counter.
109                 * @param uri the URI to add
110                 * @return this builder instance
111                 */
112                public Builder add(URI uri) {
113                        return add(KeyValuesResource.builder(uri).name(namePrefix + resourceCount).build());
114                }
115
116                /**
117                 * Adds a URI specified as a string as a source to the loader. The name of the
118                 * resource will be automatically generated based on {@link #namePrefix(String)}
119                 * and a counter.
120                 * @param uri the URI string to add
121                 * @return this builder instance
122                 */
123                public Builder add(String uri) {
124                        return add(URI.create(uri));
125                }
126
127                /**
128                 * Adds {@link Variables} for interpolation when loading key-values.
129                 * @param variables the variables to use for interpolation
130                 * @return this builder instance
131                 */
132                public Builder add(Variables variables) {
133                        this.variables.add(e -> variables);
134                        return this;
135                }
136
137                /**
138                 * Adds variables that will be resolved based on the environment. <strong>
139                 * Variables resolution order is the opposite of KeyValues. Primacy takes
140                 * precedence! </strong> This is useful if you want to use environment things for
141                 * variables that are bound to {@link KeyValuesEnvironment}. This is preferred
142                 * instead of just creating Variables from {@link System#getProperties()} or
143                 * {@link System#getenv()} directly.
144                 * @param variablesFactory function to create variables from environment.
145                 * @return this
146                 * @see Variables#ofSystemProperties(KeyValuesEnvironment)
147                 * @see Variables#ofSystemEnv(KeyValuesEnvironment)
148                 * @see #add(Variables)
149                 */
150                public Builder variables(Function<KeyValuesEnvironment, Variables> variablesFactory) {
151                        this.variables.add(variablesFactory);
152                        return this;
153                }
154
155                /**
156                 * Adds resource that will be resolved based on the environment.
157                 * @param resourceFactory function to create resource from environment.
158                 * @return this
159                 * @see #add(KeyValuesResource)
160                 */
161                public Builder resource(Function<KeyValuesEnvironment, KeyValuesResource> resourceFactory) {
162                        this.sources.add(resourceFactory);
163                        return this;
164                }
165
166                /**
167                 * Sets the resource name prefix for auto naming of resources based on a counter.
168                 * This is to support the add methods that do not specify a resource name.
169                 * @param namePrefix must follow {@value KeyValuesResource#RESOURCE_NAME_REGEX}
170                 * @return by default <code>root</code>.
171                 */
172                public Builder namePrefix(String namePrefix) {
173                        this.namePrefix = KeyValuesSource.validateName(namePrefix);
174                        return this;
175                }
176
177                /**
178                 * Builds and returns a new {@link KeyValuesLoader} based on the current state of
179                 * the builder.
180                 *
181                 * <p>
182                 * If no sources are specified, a default classpath resource
183                 * {@code classpath:/system.properties} is used.
184                 * @return a new {@link KeyValuesLoader} instance
185                 */
186                public KeyValuesLoader build() {
187                        return loaderFactory.apply(this);
188                }
189
190                /**
191                 * Loads key-values using the current builder configuration.
192                 * @return a {@link KeyValues} instance containing the loaded key-value pairs
193                 * @throws IOException if an I/O error occurs during loading
194                 * @throws FileNotFoundException if a specified resource is not found. This
195                 * exception gets special treatment if thrown if the resource is optional it will
196                 * not be an error.
197                 * @throws NoSuchFileException if a specified resource is not found. This
198                 * exception gets special treatment if thrown if the resource is optional it will
199                 * not be an error.
200                 */
201                @Override
202                public KeyValues load() throws IOException, FileNotFoundException, NoSuchFileException {
203                        return build().load();
204                }
205
206        }
207
208}
